title: A Fact About Every Country
author: EinMor
pages:
In this Museum you will
find atleast 1
interesting fact about
each UN-Recognised
Country in the World.

There are also 6
Countries for which I
made multiple facts:
The USA, The Uk,
Russia, Germany and
China because they
are mayor countries.
And Ireland for RT.
The world's first oil
paintings were drawn
not in Renaissance
Europe but in the
caves of Bamiyan, in
the central highlands
of Afghanistan around
650BC.





Albania has about
173.000 concrete
bunkers, or 1 bunker
for every 16
Albanians.








Algeria is the largest
country in Africa
since 2011, since in
2011 South Sudan got
it's independence from
Sudan.







Andorra is the
largest country in the
world without an
Airport.









A place in Angola is
called "The viewpoint
of the Moon" because,
due to erosion, the
landscape resembles
a lunar landscape.







Due to a coral reef
on the island of
Barbuda, the
champagne color of
the sand is mixed with
crushed corals making
the sand pink.






The first ever person
to be born in
Antarctica was an
Argentine boy in 1978









In Arminia, Chess is a
part of a childs
primary school
education.









The largest Highway in
the world is in
Australia, Highway 1,
that goes around the
entire country,
connecting all mayor
cities and is about
14,500km long.





The first Zoo ever
opened was in Vienna
in 1752, and it's still in
operation to this day.









Over half of all Mud
Volcanos are in
Azerbaijan










It is widely believed
that Columbus^ *rst
landfall in the new
world was on the
island of San
Salvador.

The Bahamas is the
only country with a
marching band on
their currency.


In Bahrain there is a
mesquite tree planted
in 1582 called "The
Tree of Life"
(Terraria Fans
approve).







In 2004 Bangladesh
formed the longest
human chain, with more
than 5,000,000
participant the chain
spanned from the top
north to the bottom
south, or over 1,050
km.




Barbados is the
birthplace of Rum.
And the "Mount Gay
Distillery" produces
the oldest Rum in the
world, being open
since 1703.






Belarus has the
highest consumption
of pure alcohol in the
world with 17,5 liters
per person per year.








Belgium produces
around 600.000 tons
of chocolate per
year.
Thats 544.310.844 kg.

In 2010-2011 Belgium
set a world record by
going 589 days without
a government,
however in 2020 that
record was broken...
by Belgium, this time
going 652 without one.
Belize has the first
ever Jaguar reserve
in the world called
"Cockscomb Basin
Wildlife Sanctuary".








The Kingdom of Benin
(1180-1897) had a
flag of a person
being decapitated with
a sword.








Bhutan is the world
most mountainous
country with 98,8% of
it covered with
mountains. The
average elevation is
3280m or about
10760 feet.

Bhutan is the country
with the most Orange
in it's flag with about
39%.
Bolivia has a Navy of
5000 personal, even
though they are
landlocked.









Over 2% of the
territory of Bosnia
and Herzegovina is
made up of landmines.









Botswana produces
about 40% of the
worlds Diamonds.










The largest ever bank
robbery occured on
Aug. 6-7, 2005, in
Fortaleza, Brazil,
where a gang of 10
people stole about
70m dollars/63m Euro.

Brazil has over half
of South America's
population.


The Sultan of Brunei
has a net worth of
over 20,000,000,000
(20 Billion) dollars.









Bulgaria is the oldest
country in Europe
that hasn't changed
it's name since it was
first established in
681 AD.







Burkina Faso means
"Land of
incorruptable people"
but in the 2021
corruption index only
scored 42/100.







Agriculture is so
important here that
about 90% of the
entire population
depends on jobs in
this sector.







This country is home
to the largest church
in the world, "Basilica
of our lady of peace".
Completed in 1989, it
measures518 feet tall
and covers an area
of 323,000 square
feet.

In 2007 football
player Didier Drogba
ended a 5 year civil
war in the Ivory Coast
Santo Antao is not
only the most western
island on Cape Verde,
but also the most
western point of all of
Africa.







Cambodia is the
country with the
highest percentage of
Buddhists, 97%









Cameroon touts 1738
different linguistic
groups and has more
than 200 national
languages








Canada has more
lakes than any other
country in the world
combined.









The Central African
Republic (original name
btw.) and Chad are the
only countries
alphabetically that
border each other.







This African country
only has one
television station,
Tele-Tchad, and it's
run by the state.








 The largest
permanent settlement
in Antarctica is a
Chilean city called
"Villa Las Estrellas"
and has a population
of up to 150 in the
Summer and 80 during
the Winter.




Colombia produces
50-90% of the worlds
Emeralds supply










Comoros got it's name
from the Arabic word
"Moon"










The Capital Cities of
the Congo and the DRC
are the closest
capital cities in the
world with only a river
seperating the 2
Capitals.






The Capital Cities of
the Congo and the DRC
are the closest
capital cities in the
world with only a river
seperating the 2
Capitals.






The DRC (Democratic
Republic of the Congo)
has the largest Lava
Lake in the world.









With a population of 5
Million Costa Rica is
the biggest country
without a military









The smallest Town in
the world is in Croatia,
it's called Hum, was
founded in about 1102
and has a woping
population of 30.

The geographical
center of Croatia, is
in Bosnia and
herzegovina.


This Nations biggest
income is doctors.
The country's 50,000
doctors working
abroad bring Cuba
some 11 billion dollars
annually.






The Cyprus Capital
"Nikosia" is described
as the worlds last
divided capital.









Build in 1410, the
worlds oldest
astronomical clock
still in operation is in
it's capital, Prague








Ever since July 2022
Denmark has a land
border with Canada.










Djibouti got it's name
from it's Capital city,
Djibouti, were over
70% of the population
lives.








There are only 2
countries in the world
with Purple in their
flag, Dominica and
Nicaragua.
Also, Dominica is the
country with the most
purple on it's national
Flag, with about 0,3%




The Dominican republic
is the most visited
carribean nation with
mire than 6.5 million
visitors.








Mount Chimborazo in
Ecuador is the
mountain farthest
away from the earth
center since the
earth is not 100%
spherical but a bit
oval.





Bread was invented in
Egypt at around
8,000 BC. However
back then it was
something we would
nowadays compare to
tortillas.






A town in El Salvador
has a day were they
celebrate something
called "Bals de Fuego"
were people throw
palm-sized fireballs
of kerosene at an
oposing team.





Despite it's name the
Equator doesn't go
through Equatorial
Guinea









Estonia is the least
religious country in
the world with 84% of
it's population saying
that religioun is not
important to them.







In 2018 Eswatini
changed it's name
from Swaziland to
Eswatini to not get
confused with
Switzerland anymore.







Ethiopia was one of
only 2 african nations
that were not
conquered by the
europeans and was
even able to beat the
Italians when they
tried to subjugate
them.

They also never
officially surrendered
to Italy when they
occupied them in 1936
40% of the Fijian
population are of
Indian descent since it
was under british rule
from 1874-1970, in
that time the UK gave
600.000 Indians "free
passage" to work on
sugar cane farms
there.



Finland is the most
depressed country in
Europe with 7% of it's
adult population
having it.
Ironically it is also
rated as one of the
happiest countries in
the world.




France borders more
countries you think of.
It has it's european
borders, but also has
French Guiana were it
shares a border with
Brazil and suriname
and it shares an
island in the
carribean with the
Netherlands: St. Martin
because of that
France has 11
neighboring countries.
France also has 7
current land disputes.
With Madascar,
Comoros, Mauritius,
Vanuatu, Italy, the
Netherlands and
Suriname.






Gabon has the worlds
only natural nuclear
fission reactor










The Gambias borders
were chosen by
canonballs










The Veryovkina Cave
in Georgia is the
deepest cave in the
world with a deph of
2,212m and a total
lenght of 13,5km.







In Ghana, people are
buried in very
elaborate coffins.
The theme for the
coffin is usually
based on the
person^=vocation,
and the goal is to
make a good
impression once a
person dies, and said
coffins can take up to
a month to be build.
80% of Greece is made
up of mountains.

No part of Greece is
more than 137
kilometers away from
the ocean.






Grenada has an
underwater Sculpture
park.










The entire city of
Antigua, former capital
of Guatemala, is a
UNESCO World Heritage
site.








This country's capital,
Conkary, is the wttest
capital on Earth. It
gets about 4x the
amount of rain than
the world average.







Guinea Bissau got it's
name from the people
"Guineans" and it's
capital city "Bissau"









The Kaieteur Falls in
Guyana holds the title
of being the "World's
largest single drop
waterfall" by volume
of water flowing over
it. It's average flow
rate is 663 cubic
meters per second.




In the 1936 olympics it
was discovered that
Haiti and Liechtenstein
have the same flag, a
blue top and a red
bottom, after which
Liechtenstein added a
crown and Haiti it's
coat of Arms to their
flags.



In 2022, Honduras
changed it's flag
colour from Blue to
mayan (light) blue.

Once a year in Yoro,
Honduras, it rains
fishes.





In 1946 the Hungarian
inflation was so bad
that the prices would
double every 13,5
hours.
And at one point it
introduced a
100,000,000,000,000,00
0,000 (100 Quintillion)
bank note.



In 2018 Iceland
bacame the least
populated country to
ever qualify for the
Fifa World Cup.








Although sugarcane
originated in
Southeast Asia, it was
first chemically
refined about 2,500
years ago in India.







Indonesia has so many
Islands that the State
itself doesn't even
know how many it's got.









In Iran both Man and
Woman are required
by law to take a class
on modern
contraception before
their marriage license
will be issued.






In 2015, a rare
weather phenomenon
brought hail storms to
the country, causing a
river of frozen water
to flow through Iraq's
desert.






Albert Einstein was
once offered the
presidency of Israel.
He declined.









All active/ongoing
Volcanoes in Europe
are located in Italy
with Mount Etna on
Sicily last erupting in
2021, it's 50th
recorded eruption.






Jamaica is the only
country in the world
who's flag does not
contain blue, red or
white








Japan experiences
20% of the worlds 6.0
and higher magnitude
earthquakes.









Jordan has over
100.000
archaeological and
tourist sites. Some of
those include:
The dead sea, Wadi
Rum, Jerash and (of
course) Petra.





Even though it's
classified as Asian, a
tiny part of
Kazakhstan is part of
europe, meaning
Kazakhstan is, by
default, a European
Nation.





Kenya is the country
with the best
long-distance
runners. In one Berlin
marathon runners
from this country
placed first, second,
third, fourth and fifth
in the mans category
and first, second and
fourth in the womans
category.

Kiribati, more specific
the Line Islands, are
the first places in the
world to enter the
new year.








Even though the
country has a
population of about
4.4 million. Only 1.45 of
them are Kuwaitis
meaning that they are
a minority in their own
country.





The longest poem in
the world was written
in Kyrgystan and has
about 500.553 lines
making it about 20
times as large as
"Homers Odysse" and
"Ilias" combined.





Due to the Mekong
River Laos has over
4000 Island even
though it's landlocked.









According to a
100-year height
study. Latvian Woman
are the tallest in the
world.








The City Babylos is,
possibly, the oldest
continuously inhabited
city in the world being
permanently inhabited
since about 5000 BC.

The greek word for
Papyrus is Byblos
when it was exported
to the Aegean through
Byblos. So the Word
"Bible" got it's name
from Byblos.
Lesotho is the largest
country to be fully
surrounded by
another country,
South Africa








In 1927, despite only
having 15,000
registered voters,
Charles D. B. King won
the presidental
elections with 240,000
votes.






Libya is divided into
three regions:
Tripolitania, Cyrenaica
and Fezza - which are
represented on
Libya's flag of three
horizontal stripes of
red, black and green.
However this wasn't
always the case and
from 1977 to 2011,
the flag of Libya was
just green.
Liechtenstein recieved
69,000 visitors in 2017

A company in
Liechtenstein
produces about 20%
of the Global supply
of False Teeth,
producing about 60
million pieces each
year.


The Geographical
center of Europe is in
Lithuania










Luxembourg is the
country with the
highest divorce rate,
with 87% of marriges
ending in a divorce.








Over 90% of the
wildlife in Madagascar
is not found anywhere
else on earth.
Sadly Penguins are
not included.







Lake Malawi is called
"Callender Lake" since
at it's longest it's 365
miles, and at it's widest
52 miles long.








Malaysia is estimated
to contain 20% of the
world's Species.










The area on which
Maldives capital city is
on is only 8,3 sq km
big, but it still contains
a population of
227,000 people.







14th century Mansa
Musa of Mali is
believed to be the
richest human to have
ever lived, having a
net worth of over
400,000,000,000 (400
Billion) dollars, and
crashing the economy
of every
place/country he
visited since he
always gifted gold to
everyone.
The cross in the top
left corner in the
Maltese flag is the
George Cross which
Malta was awarded
during WWII.







In January 2014, a
mexican man washed
up in the marshall
islands after 14
months adrift at sea.








The bay of
Nouadhibou in
Mauritania is the
largest ship
graveyard in the
world with over 300
shipwrecks/wrecked
ships





The national animal of
Mauritius is the dodo.











The Great Pyramid of
Cholula was build
about 2,000 years
ago. Its base is four
times larger than
Egypt's Great Pyramid
of Giza. However it's
one of the least
known Pyramids in the
world.



The Great Pyramid of
Cholula was build
about 2,000 years
ago. Its base is four
times larger than
Egypt's Great Pyramid
of Giza. However it's
one of the least
known Pyramids in the
world.



The island nation of
"The Federated States
of Micronesia" has
over 600 Islands with
some believed to be
inhabited since before
1000 BCE.






30% of people living in
Monaco are
millionaires.










Mongolia is the most
sparsely populated
country in the world,
with an average of
just 2 people per
square mile.







The tallest building in
Montenegro is just
65m big.










Dating back to 859,
the University of
Al-Karaouine in the
city of Fes el-Bali is
the oldest known
university in the
world.






Mozambique is the
highest scoring
country word in
scrabble at 34 points.









On Myanmar'n/Burmese
New Year (in April)
they celebrate a
Water Festival know as
"Thingyan" were they
have a huge water
fight.






In Namibia there is a
places called the
"Skeleton Coast" and
when the Portugese
explored the area
they called it "The
Gates of Hell".






Nauru doesn't have an
official capital city.











This Asian nation has
no independence day
because, unlike most
countries, it was
never fully
occupied/colonized by
europeans. It ceded
30 percent of it's land
to Britain following the
Anglo-Nepalese War
from 1814-1816, but
the brits were never
able to conquer it due
to it's terrain.
King Willem-Alexander
of the Netherlands
flew as a commercial
airline pilot for KLM
for 20 years, without
ever telling his
passengers that he is
their king.





New Zealand has a hill
with a name that is 85
letters long:
Taumatawhakatangihan
gakoauauotamateaturi
pukakapikimaungahoro
nukupokaiwhenuakitana
tahu.





Nicaragua accidentally
invaded costa rica in
2010 due to an error
on google maps.









Niger is named after
the River Niger.











Nigeria has the
second largest film
industry in the world
called "Nollywood" and
accounts for 5% of
the countrys GDP.







Before settling a
dispute with Greece,
North Macedonias
official name was
"Former Yugoslav
republic of north
macedonia"






Between Norway and
North Korea is only 1
country, Russia










Due to a decree by
the Sultan of Oman,
nearly all buildings in
the country are white.









A small city in Pakistan
called Sialkot
produces about 75%
of the worlds Football
balls/Soccerballs.
During World
Championships it
produces about 40
million per year.




In Palau there is a
Lake with Jellyfish
that don't have
stingers.









Some 14,000 ships
pass through the
panama Canal each
year.









Papau new guinea is
the most linguistically
diverse country in the
world with around 850
different languages
spoken.







The Paraguayan war,
also called the Triple
alliance war, was a
war from 1864 to
1870, and was so
devastating it killed
90% of the
Paraguayan male
population.




A small town in Peru,
La Rinconada, is the
highest permanent
human settlement on
earth at 5,100m above
sea level.







About a quarter of all
overseas nurses
come from the
Philippines, making it
the world's top
supplier.

4 of the 5 most
densely populated
cities are in the
Philippines with 1, 2, 3
and 5 place.

Polandball, an online
comic style was,
surprise surprise,
named after Poland.









In 2001 Portugal
became the first
country to
decriminalise all
drugs.








There are 3.39 Men
for every woman in
Qatar










The demilitarized zone
(dmz) along the
North-/Southkorean
border is, actually,
one of the most
militarized borders of
the world.






North Korea is one of
the only countries in
the world with an 100%
literacy rate.

North Korea made
World Cup History by
becoming the first
ever Asian Countrie to
advance to the
knockout stage.


Moldova has the
largest wine cellar in
the world. The Milestii
Mici houses nearly 2m
bottles, each
estimated to cost
around 480 Euro each






Romania and Chad
have the excact same
flag.










Rwanda is the Nation
with the highest
amount of Woman in
parliament at 61.3%









St. Kitts and Nevis is
both the smallest and
least populated
country in the
Americas








St. Lucia has the most
Nobel Prize
Laureate's per capita
in the world, with 2
and a small population.








This country is home
to the oldest botanical
gardens in the
Western Hemisphere
which were formed
back in 1765.







In 2011, Samoa
changed their time
zone, skipping an
entire day, the 30th
of december.
Since then many
people missed their
birthdays





San Marino was
founded in the year
301 making it not only
the oldest republic,
but also the oldest
unified country in the
world.

San Marino was the
first Country to
democratically elect a
communist government,
the "Sammarinese
communist party" was
democratically elected
and lead the country
from 1945 to 1957.










Sao Tome and Principe
were completely
uninhabitat until the
Portugese arrived.









Saudi Arabia has the
tallest light house in
the world at 133m tall,
the Jeddah Light.

Saudi Arabia is the
country with the most
green in it's flag with
about 93%.




There is a lake in
Senegal that is
naturally Pink










The Serbian language
uses both the Cyrillic
and Latin alphabet.










If you count all the
water that the
Seychelles own, then
the country is only
0.03% land and 99.97%
water.







The capital of Sierra
Leone is called
Freetown because it
was founded by freed
slaves.








When Malaysia got it's
independence,
Singapore wanted to
join it, but they
refused making
Singapore one of the
only countries ever
to get it's
independence against
it's will.



Slovenia is so often
confused with Slovakia
that representatives
of both nations meet
once a week to
exchance post that
was falsely
addressed.





Slovakia is so often
confused with Slovenia
that representatives
of both nations meet
once a week to
exchance post that
was falsely
addressed.





The Solomon Islands
are named after the
wealthy biblical King
Solomon because it
was believed they
contained great
riches.






The code for Somalia's
currency, the Somali
Shilling, is SOS.










South Africa has 3
capital cities: Pretoria,
Cape Town and
Bloemfontein.









Spain is the least
likely country in
europe to have it's
modern day borders
at the end of the 21st
century, as it
currently has 12
ongoing active
separatist movements.




Sri Lanka was the
first country to have
a female prime minister
in 1960.









Sudan, not Egypt, has
the most Pyramids.











This is the youngest
nation on earth,
achieving full
independence in 2011.









Surinam is 95%
forested and is even
so forested that it
removes more carbon
than it emits.








Sweden has the most
islands in the world
with 267,570 islands










Even thogh
Switzerland is neutral,
it accidentally invaded
it's neighboor
Lichtenstein 5 times in
39 years. In 1968,
1976, 1985, 1992 and
2007.





Syria was occupied by
multiple empires
including the:
Egyptians, Hittites,
Sumerians, Mitanni,
Assyrians, Arameans,
Babylonians, Amorites,
Canaanites, Persians,
Phoenicians, Ottomans,
Greeks, Romans,
British and many more.


Tajikistan has the
longest glacier
outside of the earth's
polar regions - the
Fedchenko.








The Full name of
Thailands capital city
is:
"Bangkok City of
angels, great city of
immortals, magnificent
city of the nine gems,
seat of the king, city
of royal palaces,
home of gods
incarnate, erected by
Vishvakarman at
Indra's behest"
East-Timor is officially
called "Timor-Leste"
which is what it's
called in Portugese.
This is because the
Malayan word "Timor"
means "East" so
East-Timor world be
calling it East-East.




In Togo's capital Lome,
merchants sell voodoo
talismans known as...
"fetishes" (an
unfortunate name).








The world's heaviest
monarch ruled Tonga
and had a weight of
208.7kg.









Limbo originated from
Trinidad











Even though
independent since
1957, Tunisia only had
5 presidents to this
day.








Turkiye, which is it's
official/turkish name
was called turkey in
english because the
name was anglicised
a.k.a.
translated/simplified
into english.
In 2022 the
government of
Turkiye/Turkey then
asked the
international
community to address
In 2018 the
Turkmenistan
President banned
Black cars since they
were to ugly for him.








Tuvalu is the least
visited country on
earth with only
around 2000 tourists
each year.








Uganda is home to 60%
of Africa's and 11% of
the worlds bird
species with about
1090 of them








In 2018 Ukraine
launched a social
media campaign to
teach people the
correct spelling of
their words as many
places are called
what it's called in
russian and not in
Ukrainian.
For example Kiev is
the russian spelling
while Kyiv is the
correct Ukrainian way.
In Dubai you can walk
to an ATM and
withdraw a gold bar.










The shortest War
ever took place
between Zanzibar and
the Uinted Kingdom,
it lasted 38 minutes.








Jose Mujica, a former
president of Uruguay,
was considered the
world's poorest
president because he
donated 90% of his
12,000 dollar monthly
income to charity.





Uzbekistan is one of
only 2 countries in
the world that is
double landlocked.
As in, they are
sorrounded by other
landlocked countries.
The other being
Liechtenstein.




In Vanuatu it's
possible to buy
citizenship for
130,000 dollars.
These make up about
30% of the country's
revenue.






Before the Vatican,
there was the Papal
States. A country that
existed from 754 to
1870 and was the
predecessor of the
Vatican and was one
of the most influential
and powerful nations
in the Italian region.



Angel Falls, in
Venezuela, is the
tallest waterfall in the
world at 979m









40% of all people in
Vietnam have the
surname "Nguyen"










A town in Yemen called
"Shibam" has about
500 high houses with
some even being as
big as 11 stories and
were build in the 16th
century making it the
oldest skyscraper
city.




32% of all Zambian
land is covered by
National Parks










The "Victoria Falls"
waterfall in Zimbabwe
is so big and loud you
can hear the water
crashing down from
over 25 miles / 40km
away.






The US doesn't have
an official language.

About 1 in 8 people in
the US has been
employed by
McDonalds.

In the US State of
Montana, Cows
outnumber the
population 3 to 1.

Kansas produces
enough wheat in 1
year to feed
everyone in the world
for 2 weeks.

If you have a

wealthier than 15% of
all US citizens.

 Dont go to Texas or

The UK loves Tea, it is
reported that the
citizens of this
country drink around
165 million cups of
Tea every day.

The UK is the largest
exporter of
independence days of
all nations, as it (at
one point) controlled
about 25% of the
entire world.
Some people confuse
Great Britain with
United Kindom.
Great Britain is the
name of the Island
while the United Kindom
is the Nation.






Russia is so big, if you
would divide the nation

european part would
still be the biggest
country in europe and
the asian part the
biggest in asia.

Russia has about 26
active separatist

Ireland has won the
Eurovision song
contest more times
than any other
country in 1970, 1980,
1987, 1992, 1993, 1994
and 1996.

In 1847 the Choctaw
tribe was displaced by
the US in the "Trail of
tears and death" but
still send 170 dollars
(5000 in todays value)
to Ireland during the
potato famine.
This Favour was
returned in 2020 when
Irish people started a
GoFundMe campaign to
help the Choctaw
people.
Currently it has
raised over 7.8 million
dollars.

During the Potato
famine the Sultan of
of the Ottoman empire
tried to send 10000
dollars in aid but the
british demanded he
only send 1000 to not
let queen victoria look
bad since she only
send 2000 dollars in
aid.
However he still send
2 ships of food in
secret to Ireland to
help them more.
The longest Place
name in Ireland is:
Muckanaghederdauhau
lia.

During the 2010 World
Cup Qualifiers Ireland
would have beaten
France, knocking them
out and qualifying for
the 2010 WC in South
Africa...

However...
A Handball Goal from
Thierry Henry
Qualified France and
knocking Ireland out.
This resulted in the
VAR (Video Assistend
Referee) to be added
to Fifa by request of
Ireland.
Making Ireland one of
the countries that
influenced
Football/Soccer the
most.
Germany has over 500
different variations
of Bread.
There even is a
German Childrens
show about a
depressed bread with
short arms and legs.
He's called "Bernd the
Bread" and has
adventures with a
Crazy green shrub
that creates machines
which explode and
a hyperactive yellow
stunt sheep.

Germany has the so
called "Autobahn"
where there is no
Speed Limit at all.

The German alphabet
also has a unique
letter, the \
It's a sharp s
pronounced sz.
There are 63 million
pairs of chopsticks
manufactured in China
every year. These
range from mass
produced disposable
ones to high-quality
sticks that can take
up to a month to make.

The word "Ketchup"
comes from a Chinese
word for pickled-fish
sauce.
Half of all pigs on
earth live in China.

Even though China is
roughly as big as the
US, China only follows
1 Time-Zone, Beijing
time.
